bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Divine comedy: the Inferno / A literal prose translation, with the text of the original collated from the best editions, and explanatory notes, by John A. Carlyle
bibl.note: Transcribed from our own digital image of original manuscript.

div1.p:
DANTE'S
DIVINE COMEDY:
THE INFERNO.
A Literal Prose Translation,
WITH
THE TEXT OF THE ORIGINAL COLLATED FROM THE BEST EDITIONS,
AND EXPLANATORY NOTES.
BY JOHN A. CARLYLE, M.D.
O degli altri poeti onore e lume,
Vagliami il lungo studio e il grande amore,
Che m'han fatto cercar lo tuo volume.
Infern.i., 82—4.
NEW YORK:
HARPER & BROTHERS, PUBLISHERS,
82 CLIFF STREET.
1849.

Prof. Charles Witte of Berlin, (Prussia) after many years investigation &c. and collecting 407 different MS copies of the Inferno, has just published a new edition, based on four of the most authentic MSS at Rome, Florence and Berlin; with, (it is said) important variations from preceding editions It is in one large vol. quarto with a photographic portrait of Dante.
THE INFERNO.
